info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 21 at 4:59PM PDT by NWS Sacramento
info.description: ...A cluster of strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northeastern Tuolumne, Alpine, eastern El Dorado, east central Placer, northeastern Calaveras and northeastern Amador Counties through 545 PM PDT... At 458 PM PDT, Doppler radar was tracking a cluster of strong thunderstorms near Kit Carson, or 10 miles southwest of Kirkwood, moving north at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Lake Alpine, Calaveras Big Trees SP, Kirkwood, Carson Pass, Big Bend Summit, Bear Valley, Kirkwood Meadows, Pollock Pines, Camino, Riverton, Pacific House, Pinecrest, Cooks Station, Lily Gap, Kit Carson, Tamarack, Fresh Pond, Long Barn, Upper Blue Lake and Kirkwood Ski Area. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
